alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 10:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN MASON, ROBERTSON AND CENTRAL BRACKEN COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM EDT... At 1057 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Brooksville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Washington, Augusta, Brooksville, Mount Olivet, Germantown, Sardis, Blue Licks Battlefield, Murphysville, Burika, Alhambra, Stonewall, Mitchells Mill, Powersville, Chatham, Tuckahoe, Piqua, Hittville, Minerva and US Route 62 at State Route 875. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
